title: Introduction to Change Management
headline: Learn about key concepts and practices involved in organisational change - people, ideas and strategies.
description: Alison's free online Change Management course introduces the key concepts and practices involved in an organisational change including people, ideas, and strategies. With this course, you will learn how to build an effective change strategy around increased competition and technological advancements. It will also help you play an effective role within an organization that is going through a period of change and adjustment.
courseDescription:
In this course, you will learn about change in organisations. Types of organisational change include: Process changes; Re-structuring; Culture change and Systems implementation. The success of any change initiative depends on the ability of the people involved to accept and embrace the desired change. Change can be disorienting, creating stress and anxiety for people and many peopleâ€™s first reaction is to try to avoid the change. Others will actively resist change through tactics such as negativity, destructive criticism and even sabotage.

You will learn how leaders in organisations can work with others, to enable them to effectively transition through organisational change. You will see how a communication strategy helps to guide communication activities through the change process and ensures that all stakeholders are actively engaged. Different communication channels (Intranet, Print and Face-to-face) are used. Organizational change is a process that is facilitated by planning and analysis, but it is also influenced by serendipity and chance. You will be able to distinguish between planned, emergent, episodic and continuous forms of organizational change.

This free Change Management course will be of great interest to professionals looking to play a prominent role in change management processes. The course will also be of interest to small business owners who want to learn more about guiding their employees through a period of change. Change is a constant feature of business. This means that the skills you will learn in this course will undoubtedly come in handy sooner or later. So why wait?   • Lesson Summary

    • Sometimes change is deliberate - a product of conscious reasoning and actions, i.e. planned change. 
    • Change sometimes unfolds in a spontaneous and unplanned way. This type of change is referred to as emergent change. 
    • 'Episodic' change is defined as intentional, discontinuous and infrequent. It is sometimes referred to as 'radical' or 'second order' change. Episodic change often involves the replacement of one program or strategy with another.
    • 'Continuous' change, is defined as ongoing, evolving and cumulative. It is also referred to as 'first order' or 'incremental' change. Continuous change is characterized by adapting and editing ideas from different sources and using them. 
    • The dominant approach to organizational change nowadays is the 'Complex Adaptive System'. This method contrasts with the 'Chaos and Complexity Theory', which is outlined in topic 3. 
    • Definition of Culture: Culture provides the context for our working lives. It defines the standards by which we expect to be judged; the processes and procedures we expect to be involved in and the activities that affect us. 
    • Different organizations have different cultures (e.g. communication policy, conservative, liberal, dress code, hierarchy, work environment etc.)
    • Culture is transmitted by: the philosophy of the organization; the approach to change and the way the leadership behaves.
